intro: Encephalartos elongatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cycad, is a member of the Zamiaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, upright trunk and pinnately compound leaves that are narrow and elongated. The plant produces cone-like structures, with male and female cones typically occurring on separate plants. It is a slow-growing, evergreen plant that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
